title: (x) Techniceuticals - Good Times {Jan}
content:
I got an ID request for my least favorite type style - Techno - and the best I can come up with to match this is a mix of [Handel Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050818042654/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/handel-gothic/) and Ray Larabie's [Zekton](http://web.archive.org/web/20050818042654/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/zekton-deluxe/zekton-deluxe/charmap.html). Then I would have to add gaps in the E from Zekton, and find a new M and R, because neither of them matches, etc.   
   
Not a good solution. Occam's Razor, or something, suggests this is too complex. It's probably a font, not a cobbled up mixture. The small lettering looks like the same font, so there are a fair number of letters to see.   
   
Can anyone recognize this one, or is it custom? (They use Bauhaus as the other font on their [home page](http://web.archive.org/web/20050818042654/http:/techniceuticals.com/), so I don't think they get a lot of custom design done, if I had to guess.)   
   
Thanks for helping me out. ![Techniceuticals Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050818042654im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49846.gif)
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
It's Larabies "Good Times", inspired from the Pontiac logo.   
   
http://www.dafont.com/en/search.php?q=goodtimes&nb\_ppp\_old=10&page=1&texte=TECHNICEUTICALS&nb\_ppp=10&classt=alpha&Envoyer=Submit
That sure looks like it. Thanks Jan.
